title: KODAK CA Series 139 cm (55 inch) Ultra HD (4K) LED Smart Android TV with Dolby Digital Plus & DTS TruSurround  (55CA0909)

product_specification.In The Box: 1 TV Unit, Remote, Wall Mount, User Manual, 2 AAA Batteries
product_specification.Supported Video Formats: MP4, MPEG, MPG, MKV, AVI, FLV, ASF
product_specification.Other Video Features: 4K HDR 10, MEMC 60Hz, 10 Bit Display, HLG, Cast, Stream 4K
product_specification.Other Audio Features: 6 Sound Mode (Standard, music, news, movie, game, user), Sound Output Device (TV Speaker, ARC, S/PDIF)
product_specification.Supported App - Others: More than 5000 app and games like Netflix, Amazon Prime,Hotstar, Zee5, Sony Liv, EROS Now, AirPlay
product_specification.Other Internet Features: Android TV 9.0, Google Play Store with 5000+ apps, Chromecast built-in, Google Assistant, LIVE TV Channels, 20+ content partners
product_specification.Other Convenience Features: Google Assistant, Lag free performance, Large memory, Bluetooth, WiFi, Voice Controlled remote
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 Year Warranty on Product & 6 Months on Accessories
product_specification.Covered in Warranty: Defect Arising Out of Faulty or Defective Material or Workmanship
product_specification.Not Covered in Warranty: The Product is Not Used According to Instructions given in the Instruction Manual. Defects Caused by Improper Use as Determined by the Company Personnel. Modification or Alteration of Any Nature is Made in the Electrical Circuitry or Physical Construction of the Set. Installation or Repair Work is Carried Out by Persons or Agency Other than Authorized by the Company. Site (Premises Where the Product is Kept) Conditions that do not Confirm to the Recommended Operating Conditions of the Machine. Original Serial Number is Removed, Obliterated or Altered from the Machine or Cabinet. Defects due to Cause Beyond Control Like Lightning, Abnormal Voltage, Acts of God or While in Transit to Service Centre or Purchaser's Residence. The Warranty does not Cover Any External Accessories (Such as Battery, Cable, Carrying Bag Etc). Dust appearing on television panel after 10 days of usage, mentioned in the Operating Instruction Manual Supplied with this Product or Any Cosmetic Parts
product_specification.Installation & Demo Details: We'll facilitate the installation and demo through authorized service engineer at your convenience The installation will be done within 48 hours of delivery of the TV.The service engineer will install your new TV, either on wall mount or on table top. Installation and demo are provided free of cost.The engineer will also help you understand your new TV's features.The process generally covers:Wall-mounted or table-top installation, as requested.Physical check of all ports, including power and USB ports. Accessories also checked.Demonstration of features and settings Quick run-through on how to operate the TV

product_description.Immersive Viewing Experience: Grab a bowl of popcorn and get ready to be in awe of the visuals on-screen, as this television boasts the 4K UHD resolution. With enhanced depth, natural colours, and textures in place, your viewing experience is set to be more immersive. This television is compatible with different HDR formats which include the HDR10 and Hybrid Log-Gamma.
product_description.MEMC Technology: The Motion Estimation, Motion Compensation (MEMC) technology will make even the fast-moving visuals appear seamless by minimizing lag. Oh, and when it comes to gaming, this TV will provide you with the ideal platform, thanks to its 10-bit display and a refresh rate of 60 Hz.

review:
So I bought this TV last week. And I already knew the why and what of this product. Why to buy it and what to expect out of it. Actual user experience is of one week.
Kodak's CA series is one of the best range of LED Television that the company has put out, competing directly against the likes of VU, Redmi, Motorola, TCL..etc.
So let's get straight into why and what -
Why - Because it's a purely made in India product which can compete and win against some of the best in this price range when compared feature to feature.
I had two concerns with this model. First it has single band wifi that will only connect with 2.4Ghz signal (I thought for streaming 4k videos you need to have 5ghz wifi frequency which will require Dual Band wifi which comes with additional cost), and second the storage is 8 GB out of which only 3.7 GB is available for use.
Have been streaming 4K videos without any lag whatsoever over 2.4 GHz wifi. So that solves the connectivity issue.
Secondly, being an android TV, it easily allows you to setup pen drive (remember to use USB 3.0) as a storage for apps. I am using a 32 GB Kingston Swivl pendrive which cost around 600rs. So this solved the storage issue. And hence my why was justified.

Now what to expect out of this model -

Picture quality - as good as any other brand in this price range and even higher. (Not comparing with LGs, Samsung's and the Sony's)
Sound quality - as good, if not better, than other brands in this price range.
Processor performance - more than enough for my requirements - UHD/4K streaming of OTT contents and XBOX gaming.
Customer service - Yet to experience it but guys from Kodak called me and asked me if the TV is working fine and also shared the customer care number and promised on site support. I live in Gurgaon. Customer care experience can vary from place to place.

Based on actual user experience I can say that this TV has proved to be more than what I had expected.

A pure value for money buy!

I ordered on 19th march morning got delivered to home around 20th March 12.30 PM and installation done with in 2 hours
1) It's like easy to install I can say plug and play
2) 4k video quality is impressive
3) Bezel less screen looks grand
4) Almost 2 days so for no problem
5) at great in online market cheapest in the segment
6) personally I am happy for the selection - KODAK 65" 4k,ANDROID 9

Superb TV in this budget category, panel is extremely bright which gives fantastic experience while watching 4K videos there is no lack and transition is smooth, lower resolution videos are also giving good experience, easy to cast from mobile and laptop. Sound quality is optimum but i have good sound system and I have connected that system with TVs Bluetooth very easily. So it's the best value for money TV in this category.

Quality of the product compared to its other competitor brands like Xiaomi, Realme, VU, TCL, etc is below expectations.
Here is feedback after 2 months of usage:
1. Sound Quality is very flat with no clarity and there is no Bass, just feels like loud noise for a low cost speaker.
2. TV remote is of very poor build and not durable. My remote stopped working after 2 months.
3. Picture quality at low resolutions like 720P or 1080 P is very bad and there seems that upscaling feature is not effective as expected.
4. Even though its a Android TV there is no Update relaeased from manufactures of the softwares. Other brands offer a much better software patch updates.
5. Android interface is very slow over the period it starts to get hanged and need to be hard reset. Some issues are there like volume missing which requires a restart. Also it takes time to restart the android boot screen.

In my opinion other popular brands are a safe option to buy since they have been there for long and large customer base ensures better software experience, features, better support from manufacturer.

Kannur ,Kerala....
I got Kodak LED android 43 (inch) 4k TV yesterday from Flipkart. Actually scheduled installation and demo after two days. But we got it one day earlier from Flipkart installation and service team.
No words to say,
Excellent installation and service from service provider (Ajith) ,he is friendly guy. Explained each and every function and make sure that TV working properly. Also give proper advices such as warranty extension,and other functions of TV for long use.

I read lots of reviews from other customers, some People says that ,they are not comfortable with installation and demo team..But Ajith ,he is entirely different from others , such a friendly personality.

Clarity : : This TV provides excellent clarity ,in SD level ,HD level and 4k level.
No compromise in picture clarity. No faded images ,it shows perfect videos in SD level..So I can give 4.9/5 rating.

So many reviews I saw this TV doesn't provide pictures clarity,now after using this Kodak TV I can say it's fake review. But it provides excellent and mind blowing clarity. Beyond expectation.

Sound : : Provides Dolby Audio, dts digital surround 30W speakers.It gives excellent sound clarity and audio clarity.
High sound at level 100 . Perfect sound.

I can tell you one thing ,this TV provides complete satisfaction for you and your family.This 43 inch 4k Kodak TV provides great mind blowing picture clearity and video clarity to your family.
It works properly in HDMI ,AVI and other formats.
Superb remote .it connects automatically with Bluetooth facility.And maximum 10 sec it will take to switch ON.
On my experience,TV's like Samsung,Mi, Intex , realme ,they won't provide clarity as like Kodak 4k TV.

*Excellent product at this range of price.
*Worth for money.
*You can buy this product without any further discussion.
*You have to take 3 yr extended warranty.
*Satisfied customer.

My journey to buy KODAK 4K UHD LED ANDROID TV...

Always i dreamt about 4K LED TV. After long months of research i came into the conclusion of buying KODAK 4K UHD LED ANDROID TV. As a online purchaser i know the cons & pros of products, so i started searching, comparing the products & reviews. Like you, the first came in my mind was brand names like SONY, LG, SAMSUNG, etc.. But as of the present situation it was hard for me to buy those brands in limited budget. I need 4K UHD LED ANDROID TV with in my budget but without any compromise in features & performance. And it was the time for the new budget TV search. I ended up with the competiting Smartphone Brands like MI TV, MOTOROLA, NOKIA, REALME, ONEPLUS etc.. While, one of my friend recommended KODAK. The first memory arised in my mind was the old Kodak film camera. But i was really confused about buying a TV from KODAK. Started deep researching gone through different reviews, finally decided to buy it.

And today, after using for one month what i can say you is..
PROS:
>The most attraction on this TV is its design. Its very light, slim design. completely BEZEL-LESS display as they offer.
>Outstanding Display performance compare to other brands. Viewing angle is also great.
>Data usage is very very less compare to smartphones.
>Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Built-in Chromecast everything works perfectly
>4K videos is very smooth & sharp. No noise or over saturation. Best LED panel.
>Android 9 user experience is amazing. No bugs or lag

CONS:
Frankly i couldn't find out any con about this product.

To be honest i am 100% satisfied with KODAK.
YES YOU CAN BUY IT! without a second thought.

Awesome 4k TV in budget, sound is decent better than any led out there in the market. Connectivity is good you need a good internet for maximum experience, comparing with vu considering they increased their price kodak is the best option right now.

Excellent!!! I am amazed with the quality of this product. I must say this TV can compete with big brands like LG, Samsung and Sony. Nice picture quality, good build quality, fast delivery, fast Installation and as it is an Android TV you can get as many apps you want to get entertained. There a minor upgrade required with in built speakers though but at this cost i can say we are good.

Overall i am a happy customer to make a business with Kodak! Keep it up.

What an amazing TV in the year of 2020 , I did all comparison with other TVs for this Configuration but this beat all other TVs from all kind of perspective and specs..
What an Specs wonderful. Picture quality is too good it's real 4k experience and Sound it's wow 30w, too clear and effective. This Android TV is the best and highly recommend. Suggest you all to experience this monster. Value for Money.. Thank you Kodak.

Delivery and installation was so quick and also provided on call assistance. Thanks...

and Service is also good.
I want to give it a 5***** star rating.

I have been using this tv for the past 5 months, so these are my thoughts:
1. Picture quality is very good, can play 720p videos without any blurry effects. Dont recommend to watch 480p videos since the clarity will be less but still watchable.

2. Sound is ok if u r in a quiet room, but with external noises it will be hard to hear unless you hav a external speakers or any other setup

3. Connectivity is good, i am using jiofi to stream all the content, hav not faced a issue. Only having 2.4ghz connection though.

4. OTT services like prime, disney+, netflix, content is good to watch with the HDR effects.

5. (Major issue) Everyone's in a while tv will turn of automatically while watching any content ( not app specific). I have encountered around 10 times till now. NOT SURE IF ITS SOFTWARE ISSUE OR HARDWARE ISSUE. but it kills the experience.

6. Remote is ok but sometimes the response might be slow, while turning on the tv ,mostly.

Please note: After purchasing this tv, will get a call from the representatives from Kodak telling that they wll extend the tv warranty by extra 6 months if we put good comments about the product and whatapp them the screenshot.

Update-Review after a couple of month's usage:

> The HDR is stopped working via HDMI( tested with ps4 and gtx 1650). Netflix dolby vision works.
> The remote stopped worki g properly after 2 months. Support center wont troubleshoot propely. They asks for video proof constantly rather than understanding the issue. They won't event hint how to buy a new remote.
> The customer service only works in the first week to get a high rating and slowly they wont care after it.
>Cannot enjoy tv properly due to the misbehaving remote(automatically returns to home/skips content. Changed battery 3 times. Battery is not the issue)

First Impressions:

My previous TV was VU 43inch fHD tv. 3 years old. The colors were bright washed, the gradient banding was high. The sound output below average.

At Present:

After a weeks usage i would say the experience is good. Like its worth the pay, but not perfect (if you like to nitpick). But as a fily driver it performs and wont let you down.

Display:

The display is good, there are slight gradient banding but wont affect the experience.
The blacks are deep. But the overall gamma is cold(can be adjusted)
When viewed from sides, small blueish tint is experienced(may be gamma thing!!).

Sometimes the colors gets over saturated or flushed out. (Have to fiddle with settings to correct these)
Tested HDR with PS4, it does make a difference in gaming.

Dolby vision: there are a couple of movies/series in Netflix that support. Tested and works.

Remote TV connectivity: update: dies very quickly, un reliable.

When switched on, takes a little time for the remote to pair up and initialize or so. For a few mins the controls will lag, after 2 mins things will become smooth.

Sound:

The tv speaker is moderate. It does the job and way better than my old VU.
Connected my 2.1 using toslink, the output is good(supports pcm and Dolby digital)

Haven't tested hdmi arc's performance and support.

Bought this TV after lot of Research and gathering information, it got delivered within 2 day's wonderful product very good picture quality and wonderful sound in such a price can't expect anything more.... Thanks Flipkart....you people are mind-blowing..👏👍

Hi, Writing this review after 19 days of usage. I always believed in the myth that TV means we should go for Sony, Samsung or LG. But the myth is finally busted. I am the proud owner of Kodak 65 inch 4K UHD TV. I cannot be we can get such a big master piece at 49K which is the cost of most of mobile phones today. It is absolutely 5 star in every aspect of technical spec.. With all the anti china sentiments around, it is perfect time to bring home a product Made in India by a very old TV manufacturing Indian company. Not sure why people should go for major brand like Sony when we have everything and more in our Indian made brand at such a competitive price. I would say just close your eyes and click the BUY button, because I have done all kind of research before buying this master piece.

I honestly request Kodak to make 75 and 85 inch TVs. I will be the first one to buy a 85 inch TV if they launch. If you ask me, every Indian should support this brand for their honest efforts in selling such a class product at this price. I used Sony 55 inch for last 5 years, this product beats Sony in every minute technical spec. I did quite a bit of research before finally settling on Kodak 4K TV. I myself is proud of my decision. Just go for it and say final good bye to all Chinese companies like mi, OnePlus, realme etc.,

Would definitely recommend this TV to everyone. Value for money. Picture quality and sound are extremely impressive. It has in built chomecast and Google assistant which makes it more easy to use. So happy with this purchase.

Excellent tv. It is more than what I expected. Value for money and service of Flipkart and installation team is fantastic. They provided the product and installation very short time. Congratulations for their team work

Writing this review after 3 days usage of a 50" TV-
Pros -
a. Delivery and installation were done within the given time frame
b. The picture quality is very good, you don't see any pixels even from a 4 feet distance.
c. Android works pretty well, connects quickly with OTT platforms (used with PrimeVideo and Hotstart).
d. Bezels are very thin, even the bottom one is just wide enough to show a Kodak logo.
e. 1.75 GB RAM works fine, I don't see any lags even while watching part of fast action movies like Aquaman, Avengers, or any dance sequences.
f. Works very well even with the hotspot network of my mobile. Watched 20-25 minutes of a movie on hotstar using my network mobile, and there was hardly any lag.

Cons -
a. Sound quality is okay, certainly has some room for improvement. Good thing is that it doesn't distort even at max volume.
b. If I unplug the TV then I have to tune the TV again, which takes almost 3-4 minutes. I think it's more an android thing, rather than Kodak, or maybe I am missing something.
c. Build quality can be improved - If I go very near to the TV, on the sides I can see a gap between the front-panel and back-screen. Thinking if I should report and ask for fix/replacement.

I am writing this review after usage of 5 days. I will try to be detailed with least possible words ;)

1. Picture Quality - It's decent given the price at the same time don't expect it to BRAVIA level. Color repro is also good and white/black is also repo'd well. Though the viewing angle is not that great. You would want to sit around 130~140 instead of 170ish as mentioned.
2. Sound Quality - This TV is loud and can produce decent mid and highs. Dont expect to produce good low's.
3. Product Quality - That's questionable as in my TV unit, I can see gaps between screen and it's base. Interestingly, it's not interfering with picture quality or with colors.
4. Apps - YouTube started crashing on 3rd day. Though, rest are loading fine.

As mentioned in title it's a decent product give the price. I will try update the review after some more usage.

I bought 65inch Kotak. This is my second 65inch TV. I purchased the second one after a year from first one. I am quite impressed with Picture quality. Good price range for this size of TV. Flipkart delivered it on time and installation was very good as I have to do wall mounting.

A good value product for the cost. The product arrived one day before schedule, neatly packed. The installer immediately followed up and it was installed on the same day. Picture quality is good. I could watch my favorite videos in 4K quality through you tube. But you must have a good Data plan. Else switch to HD or lower quality. I was a bit worried about the sound quality but I could adjust the settings to switch off the system sound and keep only the surround sound ON. After doing this, I really enjoyed listening to lot of music videos. A user friendly remote with a voice search assistant. I liked the product very much. The only con being the wall mounting stand could have been of extendable type.

This was a great deal ofcourse at this price especially, kodak amazes us with its immense picture quality(comparable to some mediocre and premium brands ) and sound effects from Dolby , connectivity and other android features are all great, Google voice assistant is also responsive. Yet there were some flaws that I could identify such as the design and build quality , when the tv is wall mounted it's difficult to reach the usb, hdmi and av ports as they are placed at the centre of the back panel. It's manageable but quite annoying sometimes. The build quality is not very good but it does satisfy us. The screen is very close to being bezel less. The 1.75 GB ram does it's job , I wouldn't say it's very fast , but yeah it's fast enough , the 8GB internal memory was a disappointment because we cannot install a lot of apps , yes we can add an external memory support , but some apps cannot be installed on usb. The product is actually the greatest we can get at this price range. Installation was done within 4 days of delivery. Overall performance: works like a charm. :)
Edit:
The remote had some issues after approx. 1 month of purchase, I contacted customer care and their service is not very satisfactory. Haven't received remote yet and the process to get it is very complicated.

Have been streaming 4K videos without any lag whatsoever
over 2.4 GHz wifi. So that solves the connectivity issue.
Secondly, being an android TV, it easily allows you to setup pen
drive (remember to use USB 3.0) as a storage for apps. I am
using a 32 GB Kingston Swivl pendrive which cost around
600rs. So this solved the storage issue. And hence my why
was justified.
Now what to expect out of this model -
Picture quality - as good as any other brand in this price range
and even higher. (Not comparing with LGs, Samsung's and the
Sony's)
Sound quality - as good, if not better, than other brands in this
price range.
Processor performance - more than enough for my
requirements - UHD/4K streaming of OTT contents and XBOX
gaming.
Customer service - Yet to experience it but guys from Kodak
called me and asked me if the TV is working fine and also
shared the customer care number and promised on site
support. I live in Gurgaon. Customer care experience can vary
from place to place.
Based on actual user experience I can say that this TV has
proved to be more than what I had expected.

Initially I was very sceptical about buying a large screen tv that too from a brand not very established in the market dominated by korean and japanese giants, yet somehow I did end up with the biggest screen tv that Kodak had to offer. What drove me into such a decision was obviously the customer reviews and the instinct. Kodak was a huge name in the picture industry but I had no clue how they would fare screen wise and I have to admit, I am quite surprised by the level of quality and value this 65" tv has "displayed". The order was delivered on time, thanks to flipkart's prompt courier service and the call from the service executive followed almost immediately afterwards. The installations went smoothly and within a week of placing the order, I was watching 4k HDR content from my own mini home theater. After a couple weeks usage, there no obvious cons that I'd like to mention upfront, but I definitely think the remote controller could have been a bit more sleek and less ornamental. Android tv is a real boon and Chromecast just make things easier. If you have access to a moderately fast internet connection, you'll hardly notice yourself withering away infront of this huge portal of infinite content. Overall I think it's quite a catch for its price point and I hope I don't have to come back here to rant in case things go south after a while.

Great TV

Hi all,

I was sceptical in buying this tv since it was new. But the pricepoint and the reviews lured me and I gave it a shot.

It's been one month of use but I think it's a good tv.

The picture quality is really good. I watch 4k shows on it and it looks spectacular.

The sound is also pretty amazing. Most TV's the sound does not work as well and you need to buy external sound bar or system but this tv has Dolby sound so even at low volume you can hear things well.

Look and feel : it looks really good. The stand is also metal so it looks premium. I did not wall mount the TV since the stand look is exceptional.

There are few cons that are not mentioned elsewhere :

WiFi connectivity : maybe this is unique to my tv but everytime I restart the tv, it connects to the wifi but shows no internet. I have to create a hotspot on my phone, connect to it and then disconnect and connect with the wifi again for it to work. It's slightly inconvenient is all

USB connectivity : I didn't realise this untill I bought the tv and it's not written anywhere specifically but you cannot connect your hard disk to the tv. It only supports pendrive with 32 gb storage. That's a real bummer because I used my hard disk to watch movies and shows on my previous Samsung TV. This is a disadvantage. If I had known earlier I would have bought another tv. But what is done is done.

I am overall happy with my purchase and Kodak should continue to make these TV's.

I evaluated all other products available in stores like SonyMony, Tata chroma, Kohinoor and many others who try to push various Chinese models. All large screen TVs have delicate plastic frames but all are elegant. Kodak is no different, in fact I find it sturdy. After purchasing i found the picture quality to be very nice and pleasing with easily accessible various picture modes like movie sports etc. Kodak TV is fast to bootup and all menus are easy to navigate. In fact I find MI4A TV, my previous purchase very sluggish and full of advertisements of various channels in patch wall which is very irritating. Sound quality is great, nothing to complaint about. Sound easily fills up my 18 by 12 feet room and I do not find any need for sound bar or external speakers. In fact this is my second Kodak TV after I bought 43 inch one for my office a few months back, you can understand my satisfaction with brand and quality. And most importantly it is proudly MADE IN INDIA. The delivery and installation were fast efficient and pleasant, done automatically without my need for calling any agency. Strongly recommend this brand and model.

What I like:
• Picture Quality, if you see it directly from front, is simply superb. The display looks great when the 4K HDR kicks in
• Sound, after enabling DTS TruSound becomes amazing. You can actually hear the difference it makes.
• Remote is pretty convenient, having all the apps buttons
• Easy to use interface

What I don't like:
• Display looks a bit white when seen from sides.
• Default settings makes the picture very contrasty in nature. Not liked by everyone.
• No 5GHz wifi support. If you really wanna pitch 4K and Dolby Vision support, why not include a chip that supports 100mbps? Seems like a poor omission from the brand.
Thank you Flipkart

Budget 4k compromise.

TL;DR

Screen bleed (more in replaced product :/)

Dolby vision performance is worse than normal 4k UHD picture.

Sometimes while starting goes into boot loop. Boots into home screen and doesn't change to other sources. have to restart.

OS gets quite laggy sometimes. May be because of heat it generates.

Heats up real good!

No dialogue sync over bluetooth.

No MEMC.

2.4ghz WiFi may not be enough for some 4k videos. Even few on YouTube. Best example, RRR's Bheem teaser in 4k failed to play over Wi-Fi, played on ethernet.

Expect scratches on TV body and debris in packaging.

Have bouht this tv 2 weeks back . bought 55inch tv for 27k in BBD sale with SBI credit card discount and upfront discount and 2300 for 2 year extended warranty. so overall purchase price 29.3k with 3 years warranty.
PRO -
picture quality - 4.5/5 for HD and 4K videos . upslacing from SD channel is not that great.Have installed Jio tv app and all HD channels are available to watch .550 nits make picture too bright can try adjusting the same from options.
sound quality - 4/5 considering budget tv and dolby suppport expected decent sound . at higher volume it is more louder . but for normal viewing will observe much difference. only for HD and 4K you might want soundbar/speakers for better feeling. 30W output is decent
connectivity - all HDMI port and USB connectivity is normal like any other tv .
internet connectivity - it has 2.4 hz support only . people dislike statin it should suuort 5g also. but 2.4G supports upto 150mbps speed and 4k videos can run smoothly in 10-15mbps so this is completely fine . also you wll get get more larger distance coverage using 2.4hz . working smoothly for me using this band 4K videos buffer sometimes that due to my inernet BW limitation nothing else. at higher speed it works smoothly.
storage and RAM - 4/5 average processor and storage but considering the price of tv this is ok . in 4 gb usable you can install many apps . not much space for installing games of higher sizes. so not much space for games though games works good which i checked few games.
customer support - like many 1 star users have mentioned it is bad . so kodak needs to improve on that .
remote - only supports Bluetooth so if remote is not working tv is useless. so extended warranty is recommended .

considering price range and 2 weeks of usage i am pretty much impressed . OTT works smoothly so i have movedfrom local cable and using JIOTV for live tv and other apps for binge watching.

so am giving 5 for overall value of money.

will update later in couple of months with the observations if any . make use of the sale and enjoy new world of OTT nd 4k smart tv . cheers guys

Don't expect that you will get everything from this tv, obviously most of the reviews are biased or they haven't used smart TV's before who are giving full ratings but here is my genuine review which you will get exactly from this TV.
Got the 43" in Rs 19700 in BBD after bank offer and using 500 coins. (Price-5/5)
Packing was poor, the box itself was damaged but the TV was safe. (Packaging-3//5)
Same day installation done, but very unprofessionally, the guy was in so much hurry and he installed the TV tilted and not in center where I told him. (Installation-2/5)
Picture quality is very good, connectivity is also good, even SD channels look nice you can watch channels without HD box and HD channels from your old SD set top box it will not look blurred or stretched, easy to use, remote is also of good quality. (Picture-5/5)
Sound quality is average, but this TV is for my parents so it's okay for them.(sound-4/5)
Final opinion- In this price no one should expect alot from this TV, you will get what you pay. And this TV does the justice. Go for it you will not regret, it will fulfill all your needs. But if you don't have budget issues than Sony or LG will be best. But obviously you're here for a budget TV, so I recommend you to purchase this TV instead of Chinese TV's, it's far better. Chinese products are just eye catching, the materials which are used in them are of very cheap quality.

Great product! Fully satisfied with the purchase.
Kodak is a name that brings a lot of good old memories from when we used to purchase its photographic film products. That's the reason I thought of trying this out.It seemed to be the best choice in this price range.
Design is good. I went for a separate wall mount than the default one as it had more range in movement and adjustment. Picture quality is great. I upgraded my setup box to HD. Though HD channels are more sharp when viewing, standard content (SD) isn't that bad. Sound is also okay.I use it mostly for home use and did not explore with content having more sound effects.
Switching to internet based apps seemed to have a slight delay, but then it might be due to my slow internet connection. For this price range and choice of brands available, I didn't have to think twice. I think of Kodak as a family friendly brand.
Final verdict: Reputed brand. Value for money. Go for it.

So I bought this TV last week. And I already knew the why and what of this product. Why to buy it and what to expect out of it. Actual user experience is of one week.
Kodak's CA series is one of the best range of LED Television that the company has put out, competing directly against the likes of VU, Redmi, Motorola, TCL..etc.
So let's get straight into why and what -
Why - Because it's a purely made in India product which can compete and win against some of the best in this price range when compared feature to feature.
I had two concerns with this model. First it has single band wifi that will only connect with 2.4Ghz signal (I thought for streaming 4k videos you need to have 5ghz wifi frequency which will require Dual Band wifi which comes with additional cost), and second the storage is 8 GB out of which only 3.7 GB is available for use.
Have been streaming 4K videos without any lag whatsoever over 2.4 GHz wifi. So that solves the connectivity issue.
Secondly, being an android TV, it easily allows you to setup pen drive (remember to use USB 3.0) as a storage for apps. I am using a 32 GB Kingston Swivl pendrive which cost around 600rs. So this solved the storage issue. And hence my why was justified.

I received this TV on 22 sep 2020 and installation done within two hours in same day of delivery, and Service engineer explained the features clearly. And I already knew the why and what of this product. Why to buy it and what to expect out of it. Actual user experience is of one week.
Kodak's UHD/4K series is one of the best range of Television that the company has put out, competing directly against the likes of MI, VU, Redmi, Motorola, TCL..etc.
So let's get straight into why and what -
Why - Because it's a purely made in India product which can compete and win against some of the best in this price range when compared feature to feature.
I had two concerns with this model. First it has single band wifi that will only connect with 2.4Ghz signal (I thought for streaming 4k videos you need to have 5ghz wifi frequency which will require Dual Band wifi which comes with additional cost), and second the storage is 8 GB out of which only 3.7 GB is available for use.
Have been streaming 4K videos without any lag whatsoever over 2.4 GHz wifi. So that solves the connectivity issue.
Secondly, being an android TV, it easily allows you to setup pen drive (remember to use USB 3.0) as a storage for apps. I am using a 32 GB Toshiba pendrive. So this solved the storage issue. And hence my why was justified.

Now what to expect out of this model -

Picture quality - as good as any other brand in this price range and even higher. (Not comparing with LGs, Samsung's and the Sony's)
Sound quality - as good, if not better, than other brands in this price range.
Processor performance - more than enough for my requirements - UHD/4K streaming of OTT contents and XBOX gaming.
Customer service - Yet to experience it but guys from Kodak called me and asked me if the TV is working fine and also shared the customer care number and promised on site support. I live in Kolkata. Customer care experience can vary from place to place.

Based on actual user experience I can say that this TV has proved to be more than what I had expected.

The Noida-based Super Plastronics Private Ltd. (SPPL) has finally upgraded its smart TV product range with the goodness of Google's Android OS.SPPL has been in the Indian market with Kodak branded televisions for four years now, and also markets televisions under the Thomson brand; the company has brand licensee agreements to use both brand names for its televisions. The company manufactures its products in India itself.
This TV offer good features – audio & video. On the performance side, it is really good and the TV supports common streaming apps natively. The newly designed remote controller is a nice change, access to additional hotkeys is a welcome change. On the display side, the 4K LED panel is good but it lacks a little in the picture delivery and there are minor issues in contrast ratio and color vibrancy.
It's a good product in this range and I'll recommend to buy this.

I searched a lot... View a lots of previews, after that I bought this one... And after a week my review on this TV is, an awesome product... Unbeatable.. Total paisa wasool product... 5/5

After using for a year...

Picture Quality: Brilliant and you can compare it with any other brand directly (Vu , MI, Sony, LG, etc.)

Sound Quality: Truly loud and clear enough.. Surround sound works too good with 30W speaker ..

When you start playing 4k videos it will lag and at times the apps ( even netflix and zee5) would stop responding...

At times the remote does not work to start the tv, you need to start the tv using the TV button

After reading the configuration and reviews, selected this TV to give a try. Here are the pros and cons.
Pros:
1. Price: This is the lowest price for 4K TV range, I can find. Got it for 22K on Aug 2020.
2. Picture Quality: The 4K picture quality is great. Can compete with any other Top Brands.
3. Frame-less design: The screen looks great with slim bezels/frame. So sleek.
4. Google Voice Remote: Great to use voice assistance using remote. It recognizes very well.
5. Wall mount: It comes with Wall mount. It's Not VESA style mount, But still good for fixed mounting on wall.
6. Installation: The service agent came next day the TV delivered. He fixed in short time. Didn't explain any features of TV (Not bothered as am well aware of the TV features).
7. Packaging: It comes with default TV Box (No extra packaging). it's delivered without any scratch.
8. Storage extension: Can use USB Drive as secondary storage to install apps (Must format it on the TV to use as default storage to install apps). Not sure what's the max memory supported, But am able to use 2 TB Portable hard disk.

Cons:
1. Bluetooth: The Bluetooth range is very very less. I can keep the speaker, less than 2 feet for lag free sound. If the speaker/Bluetooth set moved far than 2 feet then it'll start stuttering. Didn't know Bluetooth has different quality (Thought Bluetooth has default 100 meter coverage).
2. WiFi: The WiFi connectivity is very weak, 2G connectivity is not so great. It often disconnects even the modem is so close. so frustrating.
3. Android: Frankly I don't like this android TV interface. I loved H96 MAX RK3318 Android TV Box has good interface. Very limited useful apps.
4. RAM: 2GB RAM seems not sufficient. Boot time is long (2 mintues max) and apps are taking good amount of time to load. It's nature of Android TV.
5. Ports placement: All ports are placed on one side. It'll be difficult and cluttered if you use more 1 HDMI/USB ports. It has 2 USB Ports which is very close each other, can't fit 2 USB pen drives together, have to use USB cables.
6. Stand: The stand is so sleek, But not very solid. Can't place on small TV Table because it's so wide. (Center TV stand would be great.)


Overall, If you are planning to use Smart TV options then make sure you connected with LAN Cable (RJ45), not via WiFi.
If you are planning to use TV with Set top Box or Laptop or USB Drive then This TV will be great (Bang for the Buck).

Note: This TV doesn't have SD card mount (Saw somewhere advertised as it has one).

Honest review on our Kodak 55ca0909

We already have the MI TV 4 Pro 55 Inch and decided to go for the Made in India, Kodak TV (manufactured by Super Plastronics) this time for our son's room.

I will rate the TV based only on gaming and YouTube as the this TV is primarily going to be used only for that.

Display: Its great. Nice and bright and the colors pop just right. We have it connected to the Ps3 and it feels that the TVs output is much more than what it is currently being used for. With the 60 Hz display it shows its weakness during fast motion scenes due the lower frame rates but not bad at all.

Overall a solid 4/5 for display

Sound: The 30 watt speakers are more than adequate. Loud and punchy. Kept the Dolby mode on. YouTube videos and music is nice and crisp.

4/5 again for sound.

Connectivity: We have the Jio fibre 100 Mbps connection and are running it on the 5GHz band. Too bad the TV only supports the 2.4 GHz band. Speeds are decent but there is some issue with the WiFi connectivity everytime the TV boots up. This, hopefully, will be fixed through an update.

A 2.5/5 for connectivity options and functionality

Overall: 4.5/5 Build quality is average but for the price it's a no brainer. I would recommend this TV to all those looking for a decent Made in India TV.

I would give this TV a 5* rating, but I have deducted 2* because of 3 major reasons.

1. Whenever I switch on the TV to use the internet applications, it says "cannot connect to internet." I have to forget my already added wifi connection and then connect again to restore the internet.

2. I am being forced and constantly being called/messaged by SPPL to give rating in return of 3 months extended warranty. I hate being disturbed during working hours but they keep on doing this. The company has made a good product but they need to cut down on pesky marketing techniques.

3. The quality of sound can be improved. Its not upto the level of a good TV.

Barring these three reasons, there is no reason why anyone would give a bad review to this TV.

Update: After using TV for 2 weeks now, I can also deduct a * because the Chromecast on this TV sucks. Many times it wont get connected. There is no fix to the problem so you have to live with it now.

Delivery/Installation - The TV got delivered the next day and Installation was also completed the same day. Whole setup completed within 30 hours or Forder which is great. 5/5

Picture Quality - The picture quality is breathtaking. Viewing angles justify the 178° claim. Tested it with positive results 5/5

Sound - The TV gets pretty loud and for an average to large room, the sound is pretty good. (5/5)

Connectivity - One miss it doesn't support Dual Band WiFi but despite that 4K videos run seemlessly on 2.4 GHz. Though there were a few nags and input delay from the remote. (4/5)

Service - Till now the service looks pretty decent. Got a call to check for any issues with TV, will comment further with more details. (5/5)

Features - The TV ticks almost all the features advertised. But for MEMC experienced smooth transition in games/movies, would have been great if that setting was provided in the UI. (5/5)

After lots of checking here and there for all budget TVs for around 2 months, I finally decided to go for either kodak or Vu premium and later settled for Kodak Tv. Its been 3 weeks and I can pretty much say that it's the best TV available for the budget. Great picture quality, great sound and good connectivity as well. Even though the tv supports only 2.5ghz wifi, 4k videos plays with out any lag.
I have started noticing issues lately where even though wifi seems to be connected, tv cannot connect to internet and I have to switch on and off the tv wifi. I tried resetting and clearing all cache but the issue still exists.
But other than this small problem, I find it every bit worth and value for money.

Review after using kodak tv for a month:
Picture quality: best in this price range.
Sound quality: it’s decent. It can fill the room but you don’t get any bass at all.
Connectivity: comes with all the connectivity option but misses 3.5 mm jack, Would have been even better if this was included.

Storage: 4.3 gb is available for usage which is good enough for installing most commonly used tv apps, May not be sufficient if you want to install games.

Overall: value for money . There isn’t any other tv in this price range with this many features.
